original: Öberg, Gunnar, överingenjör, Hälle-kis, f. 26/5/81 i Sthlm av försäkr:tj:-m. John Ö. o. Lina Sahlsten. G. 14 m. Elsa Helleberg. Barn: Kurt f. 17, Marianne 21. — Stud:ex. v. norra real i Sthlm 00, avg:ex. fr. KTH 04. Stud:-res. t. Tyskl. 05, 09; 28. 1 :e ing. o. driftsled. v. Maltesholms Cement A-B 05-09, driftsled. o. disp :assist, v. Hellekis A-B 09>-13, v. Skånska Cement A-B Hellekisavd. 19-30, övering. där 30-46, pens. Led. av vägstyr. Medl. av Sv. tekn:fören. fr. 01. RVO, FatrGM.
translated:
Öberg, Gunnar, chief engineer, Hällekis, born on May 26, 1881 in Stockholm to insurance agent John Ö. and Lina Sahlsten. Married for 14 years to Elsa Helleberg. Children: Kurt, born in 1917, and Marianne, born in 1921. 

Education: Completed high school (Stud:ex.) at Norra Real in Stockholm in 1900. Graduated (avg:ex.) from the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) in 1904. Further studies (Stud:-res.) in Germany in 1905, 1909, and 1928.

Career: Worked as a first engineer and operations manager at Maltesholm Cement A-B from 1905 to 1909. Then served as operations manager and assistant dispatcher at Hellekis A-B from 1909 to 1913. Joined Skånska Cement A-B at the Hellekis division in 1919 and remained there until 1930. Became a chief engineer (övering.) at Skånska Cement A-B from 1930 to 1946. Retired. 

Membership and Honors: Member of the Road Authority (vägstyr.) and Swedish Association of Technology (Sv. tekn:fören.) from 1901. Received the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO) and was a FatrGM.
